Reviews.Title: “good location, reasonably priced, clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Sian W
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station and about ten min walk into duomo and city area. Room was good size with aircon, good sized bathroom, no shower screen, safe in room, breakfast was great buffet incl meats and cheeses, free internet for 12 hours of browsing however wifi connection in the room was not very good. better with a cable. Zaza for lunch was great and not too expensive Marione for dinner, queue from 630, opens at 7pm, food came out fast and was delicious, total for 2 was about €48

Reviews.Title: “Location and little else”
Reviews.Author: Dorkon22
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Everything else is average or below such. The information which I received from the front desk was either wrong or useless. I had to pay additional for AC. The breakfast was included but not worth a lot. Basically this was a no frills bed for the night. If you want to obtain any enjoyment out of your stay I would not recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than it was expected”
Reviews.Author: russianfamily
Reviews.Content: Very good choice. Purely. A number service very good. The personnel friendly. Especial gratitude for Sam. From a window a kind on street Nazionale. We got enough sleep. In the following arrival to Rome we will stop here

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, zero Value”
Reviews.Author: PlacesT0See
Reviews.Content: Stay in a hostel before you stay here. Noisy, dirty, complete lack of courtesy in front desk staff and breakfast staff, intermittent internet access and no English language TV channels. Food was stale, nothing fresh in sight and not a smile to be found. A clean hostel with polite staff, and breakfast is a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “clean cheap hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: c3rabbits
Reviews.Content: The service was fine - basic but polite. This was our second stay and once again the room was clean and comfortable with a small but functional en suite. The breakfast was all that was needed - bread roll, croisant & toast (with cheese / meat spreads, jam, honey etc) along with fruit juice & coffee / tea. There was also cereal & yogurt at the buffet. The location of the hotel was excellent - on the main bus route from termini station (but we walked the 15 mins with trolley cases to stretch our legs), and 5 minutes walk to the Forum & Victor Emanuel monument. The best bit was the central location for the money charged (good value for central location), the worst bit was the traffic noise as it was on the intersection of 2 main roads - but with the double glazing windows shut it was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisadarran
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was really worried about staying at this hotel. To my relief the reviews were completely wrong. This is a basic hotel offering a comfortable room with fridge and TV. The room was clean and very adequate for a short break. The breakfast was basic and there were not any choices but the food was lovely and coffee wonderful! The location of this hotel was excellent, you were within walking distance of the colosseum, trevi fountain etc. It is also on a bus route so getting around was very easy. The one downfall was that the road was busy all night and you were able to hear that from the room - earplugs required. If you are looking for a value for money hotel, you couldn't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Two stars is way over rated... do they have negative stars?”
Reviews.Author: misstiatokyo
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say we stayed in 9 Hotels in 21 days all of the same price range through Europe, and this was one of the more expensive ones, and the only one I would never return to or send anyone to, so I feel I can make a fair comment on this Hotel as I have others of a similar standard to compare it too. .....Don't stay here.... It reminded me of a cheap backpacker Hostel, which is not the price we were paying. The staff were friendly to us, but we were in Room 31, on the same floor as Reception, and heard arguments with other unhappy guests and reception staff. In fact we could hear everything in our room. I did not feel safe in this Hotel so I barricaded the door each night. If I had not been with my husband I would have left this Hotel and moved, but everything was prepaid so we stuck it out. There were no amenities in the room except a soap refill on the wall which was not refilled the three days we stayed. There was mould in the shower in easy to clean places. I cleaned the mould off with some toilet paper before using the shower. The sheets were thread bare and the bedcover burnt with cigarette stains. Breakfast was nice, breads, cereal and coffee. The breakfast staff were also the housekeeping staff and very nice. The location is great, we actually walked down from the train station but there are plenty of other Hotels in this area to try. The floor was lino and this made the echo problem quite bad especially on the same level as Reception. If you have to stay here and are now reading this review request a room that is NOT on the same floor as Reception or like us, you wont sleep a wink. I had to use earplugs the second and third nights as I was beyond tired. We loved Rome, and will go back. Just not here, and no.. it is NOT two stars at all! This the only "bad" review I am writing about our entire budget trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not fit for an animal”
Reviews.Author: michelle110660
Reviews.Content: The most digusting hotel we have ever encountered. No entry to hotel from street , you need to take an elevator to the 3rd floor which was the size of a shoe box. On arrival you were greeted with the most unfriendly Indian who was doing you a favour to check you in.The room was revolting, bed as hard as a rock, no hot water or pressure to shower in & you would have to ask for the remote to be able to use the air con. Breakfast was basic if you were lucky enough to have a table to sit at. The owner of the hotel would not even greet you good morning. Hotel Fiori should be rated no stars! This hotel gave us a negative feel of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing rooms! Stay in room 34!”
Reviews.Author: goodthistimeofyear
Reviews.Content: Amazing size for the price! Close to everything...we walked everywhere! The staff are a bit strange, and the internet is a little dodgy/expensive. Walk from the hotel to the Vatican...40mins, Trevi fountain...10 mins, spanish steps...15 mins, train station... 20mins. there is a nice little wine/produce shop on the lane going towards the trevi fountain, check it out.... it's amazing! Only one funny experience... we thought we had locked the door but in the middle of the night we had a visitor (accidental and drunk) lady from the room next door thinking it was here room. This was our fault for not locking the door properly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price/quality rate”
Reviews.Author: Benoit1980
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean. The bed was comfortable. Taking into account that we were only at the only to sleep, wash and have breakfast, the hotel completely fulfilled our needs. Great location with different busses stopping at the door. I would recommend this hotel to people planning to visit Roma from 9:00 till 22:00 each day.

Reviews.Title: “I see the revolting aggressive manager is still there”
Reviews.Author: sparklespot
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel in August 2006, the location was great, we knew about the extra charge for the air con, but nothing prepared us for the nastiest most aggressive hotel manager you could imagine. At one point he raised his hand to hit my friend, but stopped himself. He was so angry at her for making a cup of tea despite being told it was okay to do so by another staff member. We complained to our travel agent when we got home and we would have expected that the hotel would have been removed from the CIT brochure. The rest of the staff were most helpful, how this hotel is still in business 3 years on is beyond belief.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Disgrace”
Reviews.Author: WEREWOLF083
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel as part of a package that our travel agent put together for us. The hotel is a disgrace, I would not allow my dog to stay there. The management is rude and unhelpful. When we questioned them about the amenities advertised as compared to those actually provided, we were told that these were all available at an extra charge. Airconditioning was one of the items that were supposedly available at an extra charge. Breakfast was a joke, day old bread and soggy croissants are not breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: loproSydney
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. While the room and bathroom were quite small, it was very clean. The location of the hotel was excellent: just a short (downhill) walk to Trevi, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and cheap eateries. The bus stop for Termini is just outside the front door. It is on a noisy street, but with the windows closed you really don't notice, Breakfast only small but sufficient. Would stay again and have recommended to others. You do have to pay an extra 8Euro for air-con.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - dreadful uncaring hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMellor
Reviews.Content: Our stay was booked as a surprise gift by our son: he chose this hotel due to its central location as I am unable to walk very far for medical reasons. On arrival we were informed that our room was unavailable "due to illness of female occupant". Yeah right. I told the guys on reception that I was a doctor & would be happy to see the (alleged) sick woman but I was denied access. Despite our protests about having a firm booking which amounts to a contract, they were having none of it. They said they had instead booked us into another hotel with whom they "had an arrangement". The other hotel was over half a mile away (further away from the city centre) - no joke when your mobility is limited. Of the 2 guys, the taller Italian one was up for a stand-up row, arguing that the alternative hotel was just as close to all the places we'd want to visit. No it wasn't. What was so annoying was that we were given no choice: a refund wasn't offered, nor was a suitable alternative. If there really was an ill woman, she could have been moved out to another hotel and claimed on her travel insurance. It was clear that there'd been a double-booking, the hotel was lying to us, and we were simply the fall-guys. We were dealt with totally unsympathetically. There was no excuse for this. No compromise was offered. The alternative hotel was poorly located for our needs but we had no real choice but to relocate there as our stay was a short one and looking for alternative accommodation was not a realistic alternative. Hotel Fiori deserves to burn down for the way it treats its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful”
Reviews.Author: DBSHEFF
Reviews.Content: I must agree with the previous reviewer. This is the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune of staying at. The manager, who is also the owner, is one of the vilest people I have ever met. Our visit to Rome was completely ruined by the stay at this hotel. If you are a seasoned traveller and have experienced unpleasant stays in hotels then the experiences you have had will in NO way prepare you for the experience of staying here. If you want to give your hard earned cash to someone who should in no way work in a service industry then by all means stay here but if you would rather support others who do or at least pretend to like customers then avoid the Hotel Firoi at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES”
Reviews.Author: coolfurb21
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! The manager who is also the owner is the rudest man I have ever had the misfortune to come across! I am that insensed by the hotel I have just got in from the flight home and wanted to warn people not to stay here asap! We did not see the reviews on this website until we were due to depart the next morning and it was too late but am hoping others will think before booking! We were a party of 3 and they refused to allow us to sit together at breakfast and the staff were screaming at us for even asking for the tables to be placed together this resulted in one of our party falling badly and the manger displayed the same attitude as his staff did he did not even ask if they were injured even thought they hot their head on the floor! There are an abundance of nice hotels in better locations than this at a fraction of the price with better staff! The location is noisy and has the smallest lift you can imagine. Entrance to the hotel is through a dark lobby used by work places and people who live on the floors below the hotel! If the lift does not work you have to walk 3 floors before you even get to the reception for an unwarm welcome! Beware stay here and risk having your trip spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE. YOU REALLY WANT TO STAY AT HOTEL CAMPO DI FIORI”
Reviews.Author: RREEVE
Reviews.Content: where to begin........ this has to possibly be the most unprofessional, rudest, most vile hotel that i have ever stayed in. having been to rome before the hospitality is always second to none, so to my surprise (at what turned out to be the manager of the hotel) was the most unpleasant italian that we could hope to meet. he decided to tell us that we where far to early and that we could not put our bags in the room, for us this was fine as we were ready for some food anyway. we asked if we could leave them in the baggage hold, to his reply of a grunt and never making eye contact, he decided to dump the bags in the middle of the hallway and tell us that was simply not possible. not one for an argument and a desire for some real food we left (taking all our valuables) and headed out for the day. we returned later that evening to find our bags still in the middle of the hallway not taken up to the room to which we were allocated. we went over to the reception and to our delight (or so we thought) a new shift worker who didn't believe that we were staying there and having to show him all our documents again. as shocking as it was believable he managed to be ruder than the so called manager..... the room was cold dark and quite frankly depressing. the shower was not big enough for anyone who would dream about having more than one piece of pizza for lunch, and the amenities looked like disinfectant (sorry to say we didn't use our moneys worth!) this review could go on but my simple solution for anybody who is thinking about staying in hotel fiori FORGET IT. we left on the second night after we we rudely awoken, because there was a complaint against us, only to find out that in fact it was the room next door. the night shift person did not come back to apologize but to simply scream at the other guests in the room, stating that being foreign and staying in this hotel was a bad choice, for it was really for italians. i can assure you this much, no italian in there right mind that would want to stay in this hotel. on the other hand check yourself into hotel CAMPO DI FIORI (please don't get this mixed up!) and receive the treatment of royalty for an extra 25 pounds. it is extremely professional and location to die for. Have a glass of wine on the roof terrace or simply sit in the lobby and relax. Oh by the way hotel campo di fiori HAS a baggage room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettertas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is based above shops on 1st and 3rd floor. Rec. is on 3rd. Our room looked on to the main street. The problem with this was the noise from the street and the buses (no mufflers) coming and going as the bus stop is just outside. So we both lost alot of sleep for the three nights there (all pre paid - argh). Also the bathroom water pressure in our shower was a thick dribble. Dispite our compliant we were not moved nor offered a discount but explained they know it does this but does not know why. Both were feeling very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “How disappointing”
Reviews.Author: costaki
Reviews.Content: How disappointing... I arranged a surprise birthday present for my partner to the wonderful city of Rome. After searching for many days on the internet, the hotel Fiori looked pleasing. many of the reviews seemed to hold it in quite a positive light. With no children accompanying us we didn't have to be so fussy. It was on an extremely busy and dangerous road, with an entrance that definately didn't make us feel we were entering a hotel, but a dodgy establishment. Greeted by an ignorant man on reception, who couldn't have cared less who we were, it was apparent that this was how it was going to be! The tv didn't work and the air conditioned leaked. The room was nothing like what was advertised on the internet, but small, very basic and not particularly clean. As we arrived early evening we thought perservere and see what happens. The floor was soaking wet where the air conditioning had dripped all night, the manager refused to change our room and said that the problem was normal! We found him rude and made no eye contact or apologies. Thus we left, he expected us to pay for the three nights that were booked and we ended up paying for two and hastily left. That could have quite easily have ruined our short break if we had not found the Campo Di Fiori apartments with their friendly staff that instilled a bit of faith once more in our short visit. Also it was in a much better location, just off the square of Campo Di Fiori and 55 euros cheaper per night!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at the Hotel Fiori. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed had a firm mattress. The bathroom is very small and the shower was particulary small, for a larger person I could see this being a problem. The shower narrowed at the corner, it was a corner unit. The location was great, it took 5 minutes to walk to the collesium. I arrived late in the evening and was greeted by a freindly member of staff, who was very helpful. The breakfast room was fine, although I have had better and larger breakfasts it was fine for the money. We were served a bread roll and a croissant with a cheese spread and a ham pate. We could opt for coffee or a cup of tea. There were 2 members of staff serving breakfast. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a fantastic location and the room was really nice and big. It is very noisy on Via Nationale when the windows are open, but I was surprised by how much noise the windows cut out when shut. My complaints about the hotel are about the unhelpful and rude man at reception (the younger one...as the older man was lovely). He spoke on the phone non-stop and wouldn't get off any earlier to assist hotel customers. Understanding a bit of Italian I can tell you they were mainly personal calls. Also, advice on their taxi service, we booked our return to the airport with their taxi booking service because it cost the same as what we paid on the way in, 45Euro. The taxi was 40 minutes late and the rude man at reception wouldn't let us go down to wait "because we might take any taxi that comes and they won't get their money". All in all, the hotel itself was really nice, but there are so many nice hotels in Rome that I wouldn't choose to return.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for one night only after staying at Hotel Giardino (which is in the same building and just around the corner). The experience did not compare. Out of 8 hotels we stayed at in England, France and Italy, this was our least favorite. It was noisy and the group of people staying there were loud and were an odd mix. The staff attempted to be nice but mostly watched tv and talked on the phone. Our room was right on Nationale as well as next to the breakfast room so there was no chance of us sleeping in past 7:15. Also, air conditioning was not included and it was too noisy to sleep with the windows open. We paid less and had a much better experience at Hotel Giardino!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerpTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room at Hotel Fiori. The room had everything we needed, and was clean for the most part. The wallpaper was coming off from under the A/C unit. For the most part the hotel staff was nice and cordial. As was previoulsly stated the morning guy didnt speak a lick of english making it very hard to ask him why we never recieved our wake up call. The over night gentleman was very abrasive and hard to talk to. It got to the point where we just wanted to avoid him at all costs. The hotel was in an excellent location, walking distance to everything except Vatican City. This hotel was ok, and if not for the one rude staff member the staff was helpful enough. I think when I return to Rome I will look into other options.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Little_Blondie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights having read reasonably good reviews on trip advisor. It was central to nearly all the main sites and competitively priced so met our standard requirements! However, from the moment of our arrival our expectations were dashed by the attitude of the member of staff at reception. He queried our booking asking if we realised that we had booked a double room with a double bed. My husband is older than I am and we felt humiliated by his rude and patronising attitude. The rooms and bathroom were clean but basic. We experienced the same noise levels as other members have mentioned. The breakfast was very basic consisting of 1 roll and 1 croissant only (with the usual accompaniments). There is also no bar at the hotel despite what some websites say. On the plus side it is very central and within walking distance to most of the main attractions with some bars and restaurants a few minutes walk away. Overall we enjoyed our trip but would not return to the Hotel Fiori and we would not recommend it to anyone that we knew.

Reviews.Title: “a dim view”
Reviews.Author: AKmom
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a triple room in Oct of 2004. The location was very good and the room was attractive and clean. The A.M.frontdesk person did not speak very good english, he was not helpful at all. We needed a phone number to reserve a room in Venice and he could not help. I finally went all the way to the train station to find a tourist office and I brought him back the number, used up several hours of our short time in Rome. Then he said he had the phone number! Not very bright! I asked for lightbulbs because half were out in our room, never got them. Very annoying at night not to be able to use the bedside lamp and was difficult to apply makeup in the room mirror with the dim light!

Reviews.Title: “simply great :-)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Fiori for ten days and have to say i was very satisfied. Knowing its two stars only, I was sceptic at first, but when I finally saw the room, I realized I was worried for no reason. Room was perfectly nice and clean, and bathroom was new and always clean and shiny as well. Towels were changed daily, sheets every 2-3 days. I was staying in a single room, which was not so big, but very cousy, and my friends took double room, which was VERY large and great too. Hotel is in great position, to Colosseo, Trevi Fountain and other attractions I neded to walk just few minutes, and train station and subway too. Stuff was helpfull and always friendly. I highly recommand this hotel, its more like 4 stars ,than two. The only not so nice thing was elevator, that seems a bit old and untidy. But the rest is simply perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: PineViewDr
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome started off on a terrific note with a wonderful stay at Hotel Fiori. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms, the clean roomy bathrooms and a beautiful breakfast room with delicious cappuccino each morning. Rented a triple room and a double; the triple fronted Via Nazionale with a gorgeous view and the double, though without the view, was wonderfully quiet. Great location, friendly staff - would definitely recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: fizzyretro
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a twin room (80.000 Euros) for a few nights over the summer. Having lived in Rome we were looking for something central but far enough away from Termini Train Station to be safe and comfortable! The location is ideal (lower end of Via Nazionale, next to Piazza Venezia), you can walk it from the station in 15 mins providing you haven´t brought the kitchen sink or you can get a taxi for next to nothing. Hotel is basic but staff are friendly. The twin room was spacious enough and the bathroom was ample. I say this as someone used to European sizes, by US standards its a wee bit cramped...the shower cubicle is mini! We were able to check in early and leave our luggage there after check out, on our last day. This hotel offers no frills but the rooms are clean and the staff accommodating. We slept through breakfast so can´t vouch for that. I can sleep through anything which is just as well because traffic noise may pose a problem for light sleepers, especially if you are assigned a room at the front of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over-all an enjoyable stay, mainly because it is in an excellent location for this 'no-frills' hotel. Very basic in every way (don't expect a hearty breakfast or exuberant welcome) but the room was clean and private, with en-suite, which was the main thing. my only real problem was the noise levels - the main road just outside, an the room was as close as you could get to the breakfast room, so clattering and talking from 6.30am. some ear-plugs soon sorted that out! And it was a little over budget. I would stay here again, but only if i could guarantee my room was in a quieter part of the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: teachertim
Reviews.Content: Me and two friends stayed at this hotel in Late October 2003. We stayed in a Triple room, which was very very clean, good size, well decorated and generally very very good. Some reviews have commented on road noise in the rooms, ours was on the first floor over the road junction, and with the windows open it was noisy, but with the double glazed windows closed you can't hear a thing ! Rooms also have ac so there is never a need to open your windows. Breakfast is very nice, served by very friendly English speaking ladies. Reception staff are very helpful and speek good English. Another bonus at this hotel is that you can leave your baggage safe after you have checked out, leaving you chance to explore Rome before you have to get your plane if it is an evening flight. Would stay here again without question. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Central & friendly but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fiori in September 03. The hotel is on the 1st and 3rd floors of a building which is very central and an easy walk to all the main sights. Don't be put off by the scary looking lift! The rooms were clean, a good size and well decorated; the staff were very helpful too. Breakfasts were some of the best we've had in Italy (pastries, bread, preserves, pate and cheese) served with excellent fresh coffee.Beware of the road noise from the Via Nazionale, if you are a light sleeper take ear plugs - as two in our party had to do. With the glass closed over the shutters I found it fine (air con) but without, it was very loud; even though we'd asked if we could have a 'quieter' room when we made the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fiori is a nice hotel in the center of Rome very close to all the tourist attractions (10 mins. walk to Trevi Fountain, Colloseum, Forum Romanum etc.)The hotel is cheap and very clean, nice rooms with airco and their own bathroom. Management is helpful and polite and they all speak English (as most of the guests). In short a perfect hotel for a lowe rate in a great area!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Fiori
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale 163, 00184 Rome, Italy
